title: Semantic HTML
description: Learn to write meaningful and accessible HTML using semantic tags to improve accessibility and SEO.

steps.description: Introduce semantic HTML and its benefits for accessibility and SEO.
steps.notes: Semantic HTML tags describe the purpose of content, unlike generic <div> and <span>. They improve accessibility for screen readers and SEO for search engines.

steps.description: Add a <header> tag with a heading and navigation.
steps.expected_code:
Welcome to My Awesome Website

  • Home
  • About
  • Services
  • Contact
steps.notes: The <header> tag typically contains introductory content like logos, navigation, or titles. <nav> defines navigation links.

steps.description: Add a <main> tag with two <article> elements.
steps.expected_code:
First Main Article

This is the main content of our first article...

Second Article

Here's some more important information in our second article...
steps.notes: <main> holds the primary content. <article> represents independent, reusable content like blog posts.

steps.description: Add an <aside> tag for related content.
steps.expected_code:
Related Content

  • Link to related article
  • Another interesting link
steps.notes: <aside> is for content related to but not central to the main content, like sidebars or pull quotes.

steps.description: Add a <footer> tag with copyright and links.
steps.expected_code:
Â© 2025 My Awesome Website

Privacy Policy | Terms of Service
steps.notes: <footer> contains end-of-page information like copyright or contact details.

steps.description: Assignment: Add a third <article> element inside <main>.
steps.expected_code:
Another Blog Post

This is some more content for our third blog post. It could contain interesting details or updates.
steps.notes: The assignment tests understanding of <article> as independent content. Users should add it inside <main>.

general_notes: Semantic HTML improves accessibility (e.g., for screen readers) and SEO by clearly defining content roles. Use semantic tags to structure layouts logically.
